popt4jlib.GradientDescent

Class OneDStepQuantumOptimizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.GradientDescent.OneDStepQuantumOptimizer

  • public final class OneDStepQuantumOptimizer
extends java.lang.Object
    the class implements a minimization method for a function alone one of its variables, using an initial starting point x0, and a quantum step-size that the variable must be constrained to take values on multiples of. The class is not thread-safe (reentrant), but the main method argmin() may be called concurrently from multiple threads as long as it is called on different objects.

    Notes:

    • 2018-12-29: class is useful enough to be made public.
    • 2020-04-18: restored debug messages, added maxcount check for iterating over an interval where the function remains essentially constant.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2020

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      PairSer argmin(FunctionIntf f, VectorIntf x0, java.util.HashMap fparams, int varindex, double stepquantum, double lowerbound, double upperbound, int niterbnd, int multfactor, double ftol, int maxiterswithsamefunctionval, int maxnumfuncevals)
      computes a local minimum of the restriction of the function f in the j-th variable, under the box-constraints lowerbound ≤ x_j ≤ upperbound, and also under the constraint that x_j = x0_j + k*stepquantum where k is an integer quantity.
      private double detdir(FunctionIntf f, java.util.HashMap params, VectorIntf x, int j, double eps, double lb, double ub, double ftol, int maxiterswithsamefunctionval)
      determine in which direction (up or down) the function f decreases, along the j-th variable, or return zero.
      (package private) int getDir()
      if the return value is zero, it means that the optimization process did not produce a new result: the starting point was already (near-) minimal.
      (package private) double getVal()
      the best objective value found.

      • argmin

        public PairSer argmin(FunctionIntf f,
                      VectorIntf x0,
                      java.util.HashMap fparams,
                      int varindex,
                      double stepquantum,
                      double lowerbound,
                      double upperbound,
                      int niterbnd,
                      int multfactor,
                      double ftol,
                      int maxiterswithsamefunctionval,
                      int maxnumfuncevals)
               throws OptimizerException,
                      ParallelException
        computes a local minimum of the restriction of the function f in the j-th variable, under the box-constraints lowerbound ≤ x_j ≤ upperbound, and also under the constraint that x_j = x0_j + k*stepquantum where k is an integer quantity.
        Parameters:
        f - FunctionIntf the function to optimize must accept arguments of type VectorIntf
        x0 - VectorIntf the initial point
        fparams - HashMap the function params
        varindex - int the dimension along which to minimize (range in [0,...n))
        stepquantum - double
        lowerbound - double
        upperbound - double
        niterbnd - int how many iterations to proceed in the same direction before incrementing the current step-size
        multfactor - int the mult factor by which to multiply the current step-size after a number of iterations are all in the same direction
        ftol - double the function tolerance below which two function evals are considered the same
        maxiterswithsamefunctionval - int the number of function evaluations performed in the detdir() auxiliary method to determine the direction of descent when function values are "almost" (within ftol) the same
        maxnumfuncevals - int the maximum number of function evaluations this call is allowed to perform befofe calling it quits.
        Returns:
        PairSer // PairSer<Double arg, Double val>
        Throws:
        OptimizerException
        ParallelException

      • detdir

        private double detdir(FunctionIntf f,
                      java.util.HashMap params,
                      VectorIntf x,
                      int j,
                      double eps,
                      double lb,
                      double ub,
                      double ftol,
                      int maxiterswithsamefunctionval)
               throws ParallelException,
                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        determine in which direction (up or down) the function f decreases, along the j-th variable, or return zero.
        Parameters:
        f - FunctionIntf the function
        params - HashMap parameters of the function
        x - VectorIntf the argument
        j - int the index of the variable in question (in {0,...n-1})
        eps - double
        lb - double
        ub - double
        ftol - double
        maxiterswithsamefunctionval - int
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        ParallelException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
